snippet: More soldiers are deserting the Iraqi Army, turning the tide of the war and fragmenting an institution that was supposed to provide a common sense of citizenship.
abstract: Iraqi Army is having its power blunted by a rise in desertions after months of grinding conflict against resurgent militant movement; toll of desertions comes into sharp relief as soldiers and their commanders abandon bases in Mosul, all but ceding the city to extremist fighters belonging to the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and SUADAD AL-SALHY
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Amman, Jordan, and Suadad Al-Salhy from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: More soldiers are deserting the Iraqi Army, turning the tide of the war and fragmenting an institution that was supposed to provide a common sense of citizenship.

headline.main: Exhausted and Bereft, Iraqi Soldiers Quit Fight
headline.print_headline: Exhausted and Bereft, Iraqi Soldiers Quit Fight

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
